result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Signed by Commissioner Rieck on 10/26/2022.

8:29 AM Defendant Timothy S. Hegwood in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Timothy S. Hegwood.  Prosecuting attorney Kristi J Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin. This matter is tagging along with the defendant's other felony matter. DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2). Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit. To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days. Attorney Griffis is asking for Melissa Westendorf to be the examiner. The Court will set this matter before the Trial Court for a review on competency. Bail remains as fixed.
Review hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on October 26, 2022 at 08:15 am.

DEFENDANT PREVIOUSLY POSTED $3,000.00, NEEDS TO POST AN ADDITIONAL $2,000.00. 
Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS. CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.

10:32 AM Defendant Timothy S. Hegwood in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
ADA Thompson states that pretrial offer is now revoked, as it was contingent on waiving the prelim.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Deputy Anthony Ledvina, of the Waukesha County Sheriffs Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Thompson.
Cross examination by attorney Griffis.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State presents closing arguments and moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
